alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 4:41PM MST until August 23 at 7:30PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave. * WHEN...Until 745 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 441 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kingman, New Kingman-Butler and Golden Valley. - This includes the following roads... Hualapai Mountain Road between mile markers 1 and 9. State Route 68 in Mohave County between mile markers 25 and 28. Oatman Highway between mile markers 36 and 47. Stockton Hill Road between mile markers 1 and 9. Highway 93 in Mohave County between mile markers 65 and 70. Interstate 40 in Arizona between mile markers 33 and 60. Route 66 between mile markers 57 and 66. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
